oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Small broadside advertising a local minstrel show. The broadside provides a listing of the entire program and the price of admission.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Minstrels; Entertainers; Minstrel shows; Theatrical posters; Singers
Broadsides; Minstrels; Minstrel music; Fayetteville (Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The minstrel show, or minstrelsy, was an American entertainment consisting of comic skits, variety acts, dancing, and music, performed by white people in blackface or even, especially after the Civil War, blacks in blackface. Minstrel shows lampooned African Americans as ignorant, lazy, buffoonish, superstitious, joyous, and musical. The heyday of the minstrel show was the period between 1840 and 1880.
